renderGraph

Class RenderGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderGraph.RenderGraph

  • public class RenderGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class offers two methods for rendering a graph either as a run-of-the-mill graph or as a bipartite graph. Either way, the graph is to be passed as an instance of a class implementing the RenderableGraph-Interface. This absolves the user of the duty to prepare a graph representation in the form of multidimensional arrays or other such grievances.
    Author:
    Philip Muench / AG Kombinatorische Optimierung

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void renderBipartite(RenderableGraph graph, int cardinality1, java.lang.String filename)
      Render the graph as a bipartite graph, two rows of nodes side-by-side.
      static void renderGraph(RenderableGraph graph, java.lang.String filename)
      Render the graph with all nodes arranged in a circle

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • renderGraph

        public static void renderGraph(RenderableGraph graph,
               java.lang.String filename)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Render the graph with all nodes arranged in a circle
        Parameters:
        graph - instance of a user-supplied graph representation class
        filename - the path and filename of the png output file. Should end in .png, or opening it in MS Paint et al. will not immediately be possible.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO Error occurs
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if there is a problem with the RenderableGraph.

      • renderBipartite

        public static void renderBipartite(RenderableGraph graph,
                   int cardinality1,
                   java.lang.String filename)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Render the graph as a bipartite graph, two rows of nodes side-by-side.
        Parameters:
        graph - instance of a user-supplied graph representation class
        cardinality1 - cardinality of one of the sets of nodes. This set will contain the nodes with indices0 through cardinality1 - 1, the other the nodes with indices cardinality1 through graph.getNodeCount().
        filename - the path and filename of the png output file. Should end in .png, or opening it in MS Paint et al. will not immediately be possible.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO Error occurs
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if there is a problem with the RenderableGraph.
